required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Observational Follow-Up Study of the Incidence of Cancer and Mortality in Patients From the SEAS (Simvastatin and Ezetimibe in Aortic Stenosis) Trial (MK-0653A-043-10)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multinational, Observational Follow-Up Study of the Incidence of Cancer and Mortality in Patients From the SEAS Trial

collaborator.agency: Institute of Applied Economics Aps, Denmark

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this extension is to observe the incidence rates of cancer, total mortality, and mortality due to cancer over a 21 month follow-up period in patients from the SEAS trial (2004_050, MK0653A-043; NCT00092677).

detailed_description.textblock: The SEAS Follow-up Study is a 21 month extension to the base protocol (2004_050, MK0653A-043; NCT00092677). The main objective of the extension is to observe the incidence rates of cancer, total mortality, and mortality due to cancer over a 21 month follow-up period (from 04-March 2008 to 31-December 2009) in patients from the SEAS clinical trial. The sources of study data will include data collected from national cancer and death registries as well as data from the original clinical trial. No patient visits will occur. National cancer and death registries exist in 5 of the 7 countries that participated in the base SEAS trial. At the time of Follow-up study initiation, accessing the registry data in Ireland was not feasible due to local regulations and Cancer and Death registries did not exist in Germany. As a result, data will be collected only for all SEAS patients known to be alive at the end of the base study originating from Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Finland, and the United Kingdom.

primary_outcome.measure: Crude Rate of Newly Diagnosed Cancer-Follow-up Primary Cohort
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 21 Months after the end of the SEAS (base) study
primary_outcome.description: Any incidence of cancer reported during follow-up that was assessed by the Expert Review Committee to be a new case of cancer. The crude new cancer rates for each arm were calculated as follows: Number of participants in the arm was multiplied by the Duration of Follow-up (days) and divided by 365 (days per year) to establish the Total Participant-years for the arm. The Number of New Cancers reported was then divided by the Total Participant-years and the resultant quotient was then multiplied by 100 to determine the Crude New Cancer Rate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Crude Rate of Death (Any Cause) - Follow-up Total Cohort
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 21 Months after the end of the base study
secondary_outcome.description: All deaths reported during follow-up were reviewed by the Expert Review Committee to ascertain cause of death. The crude rates of death for each arm were calculated as follows: Number of participants in the arm was multiplied by the Duration of Follow-up (days) and divided by 365 (days per year) to establish the Total Participant-years for the arm. The Number of Deaths (any cause) reported was divided by the Total Participant-years and the resultant quotient was then multiplied by 100 to determine the Rate of Death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Crude Rate of Death Due to Cancer - Follow-up Primary Cohort
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 21 Months after the end of the base study
secondary_outcome.description: All deaths reported during follow-up were reviewed by the Expert Review Committee to ascertain if cancer was cause of death. The crude rates of death due to cancer for each arm were calculated as follows: Number of participants in the arm was multiplied by the Duration of Follow-up (days) and divided by 365 (days per year) to establish the Total Participant-years for the arm. The Number of Deaths due to Cancer reported was divided by the Total Participant-years and the resultant quotient was then multiplied by 100 to determine the Crude Rate of Death Due to Cancer.

arm_group.description: Participants who received Ezetimibe/Simvastatin 10/40 mg in the base study
Participants who received placebo in the base study

study_pop.textblock: The cohort will include all patients from the five participating countries (Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Finland, and United Kingdom) who were randomized into the SEAS base study and who were known to be alive at the end of the base study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The cohort will include all patients from the five participating countries (Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Finland, and United Kingdom) who were randomized into the SEAS base study and who were known to be alive at the end of the base study

link.description: Current view of trial on ClinicalTrials.gov

results_reference.citation: Green A, Ramey DR, Emneus M, Iachina M, Stavem K, Bolin K, McNally R, Busch-Sørensen M, Willenheimer R, Egstrup K, Kesäniemi YA, Ray S, Basta N, Kent C, Pedersen TR. Incidence of cancer and mortality in patients from the Simvastatin and Ezetimibe in Aortic Stenosis (SEAS) trial. Am J Cardiol. 2014 Nov 15;114(10):1518-22. doi: 10.1016/j.amjcard.2014.08.016. Epub 2014 Aug 27.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: All participants from five countries (Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Finland, and United Kingdom) who completed the SEAS base study and who were known to be alive at the end of the base study.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 1873 participants in the SEAS base study, 1392 were eligible for inclusion in this follow-up study. Of these 1392 participants, 33 were excluded due to incomplete base study data or because follow-up data could not be obtained, leaving 1359 participants in the follow-up study.

group.description: Participants who received Ezetimibe/Simvastatin 10/40 mg in the base study

outcome.title: Crude Rate of Death (Any Cause) - Follow-up Total Cohort
outcome.description: All deaths reported during follow-up were reviewed by the Expert Review Committee to ascertain cause of death. The crude rates of death for each arm were calculated as follows: Number of participants in the arm was multiplied by the Duration of Follow-up (days) and divided by 365 (days per year) to establish the Total Participant-years for the arm. The Number of Deaths (any cause) reported was divided by the Total Participant-years and the resultant quotient was then multiplied by 100 to determine the Rate of Death.
outcome.time_frame: up to 21 Months after the end of the base study
outcome.population: Primary analysis population was Follow-Up Total Cohort defined as all participants enrolled in the study.

group.title: Ezetimibe/Simvastatin 10/40 mg
group.description: Participants who received Ezetimibe/Simvastatin 10/40 mg in the base study

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants who received placebo in the base study

measure.title: Crude Rate of Death (Any Cause) - Follow-up Total Cohort
measure.description: All deaths reported during follow-up were reviewed by the Expert Review Committee to ascertain cause of death. The crude rates of death for each arm were calculated as follows: Number of participants in the arm was multiplied by the Duration of Follow-up (days) and divided by 365 (days per year) to establish the Total Participant-years for the arm. The Number of Deaths (any cause) reported was divided by the Total Participant-years and the resultant quotient was then multiplied by 100 to determine the Rate of Death.
measure.population: Primary analysis population was Follow-Up Total Cohort defined as all participants enrolled in the study.

analysis.estimate_desc: Hazard Ratio obtained by dividing the crude rate of death (any cause) reported in the Ezetimibe/Simvastatin 10/40 arm by the crude rate of death (any cause) in the Placebo arm

outcome.title: Crude Rate of Death Due to Cancer - Follow-up Primary Cohort
outcome.description: All deaths reported during follow-up were reviewed by the Expert Review Committee to ascertain if cancer was cause of death. The crude rates of death due to cancer for each arm were calculated as follows: Number of participants in the arm was multiplied by the Duration of Follow-up (days) and divided by 365 (days per year) to establish the Total Participant-years for the arm. The Number of Deaths due to Cancer reported was divided by the Total Participant-years and the resultant quotient was then multiplied by 100 to determine the Crude Rate of Death Due to Cancer.
outcome.time_frame: up to 21 Months after the end of the base study
outcome.population: Analysis population was Follow-up Primary Cohort defined as all participants in the follow-up study without a history of cancer before the start of the follow-up period.

measure.title: Crude Rate of Death Due to Cancer - Follow-up Primary Cohort
measure.description: All deaths reported during follow-up were reviewed by the Expert Review Committee to ascertain if cancer was cause of death. The crude rates of death due to cancer for each arm were calculated as follows: Number of participants in the arm was multiplied by the Duration of Follow-up (days) and divided by 365 (days per year) to establish the Total Participant-years for the arm. The Number of Deaths due to Cancer reported was divided by the Total Participant-years and the resultant quotient was then multiplied by 100 to determine the Crude Rate of Death Due to Cancer.
measure.population: Analysis population was Follow-up Primary Cohort defined as all participants in the follow-up study without a history of cancer before the start of the follow-up period.

analysis.estimate_desc: Hazard Ratio obtained by dividing the crude rate of death from cancer reported in the Ezetimibe/Simvastatin 10/40 arm by the crude rate of death from cancer in the Placebo arm

outcome.title: Crude Rate of Newly Diagnosed Cancer-Follow-up Primary Cohort
outcome.description: Any incidence of cancer reported during follow-up that was assessed by the Expert Review Committee to be a new case of cancer. The crude new cancer rates for each arm were calculated as follows: Number of participants in the arm was multiplied by the Duration of Follow-up (days) and divided by 365 (days per year) to establish the Total Participant-years for the arm. The Number of New Cancers reported was then divided by the Total Participant-years and the resultant quotient was then multiplied by 100 to determine the Crude New Cancer Rate.
outcome.time_frame: up to 21 Months after the end of the SEAS (base) study
outcome.population: Analysis population was Follow-up Primary Cohort defined as all participants in the follow-up study without a history of cancer before the start of the follow-up period.

measure.title: Crude Rate of Newly Diagnosed Cancer-Follow-up Primary Cohort
measure.description: Any incidence of cancer reported during follow-up that was assessed by the Expert Review Committee to be a new case of cancer. The crude new cancer rates for each arm were calculated as follows: Number of participants in the arm was multiplied by the Duration of Follow-up (days) and divided by 365 (days per year) to establish the Total Participant-years for the arm. The Number of New Cancers reported was then divided by the Total Participant-years and the resultant quotient was then multiplied by 100 to determine the Crude New Cancer Rate.
measure.population: Analysis population was Follow-up Primary Cohort defined as all participants in the follow-up study without a history of cancer before the start of the follow-up period.

analysis.estimate_desc: Hazard Ratio obtained by dividing the crude rate of new cancers reported in the Ezetimibe/Simvastatin 10/40 arm by the crude rate of newly diagnosed cancers in the the Placebo arm

reported_events.desc: No formal reporting or recording of adverse events was conducted during this observational study

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The SPONSOR must have the opportunity to review all proposed abstracts, manuscripts, or presentations regarding this study 60 days prior to submission for publication/presentation. Any information identified by the SPONSOR as confidential must be deleted prior to submission. SPONSOR review can be expedited to meet publication guidelines.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
